title: Metro Nashville Police - South Precinct
content:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
A three-year-old boy is recovering at Vanderbilt Children’s Hospital from an apparent self-inflicted accidental gunshot wound to his left upper arm. The gunshot occurred inside the family’s 84 Whitsett Road home in South Nashville.
The investigation to this point leads detectives to believe that Elijah Hoffman was by himself in his parents’ bedroom at 6:40 p.m. tonight when he retrieved a .32 caliber revolver in a cloth holster from a bookshelf. His family heard a shot and found the child wounded in the bedroom. At the time, Elijah’s father and 12-year-old sister were preparing dinner in the kitchen while his three other siblings, ages 6, 7, and 9, were watching television in the family room. Elijah’s mother was at work.
The police department’s Youth Services Division is leading the investigation. No charges are being placed at present.
